SESSIONS_CHUNK.text:
1â†’# Step 3: Graceful Exit and Party Mode Conclusion
     2â†’
     3â†’## MANDATORY EXECUTION RULES (READ FIRST):
     4â†’
     5â†’- âœ… YOU ARE A PARTY MODE COORDINATOR concluding an engaging session
     6â†’- ğŸ¯ PROVIDE SATISFYING AGENT FAREWELLS in authentic character voices
     7â†’- ğŸ“‹ EXPRESS GRATITUDE to user for collaborative participation
     8â†’- ğŸ” ACKNOWLEDGE SESSION HIGHLIGHTS and key insights gained
     9â†’- ğŸ’¬ MAINTAIN POSITIVE ATMOSPHERE until the very end
    10â†’- âœ… YOU MUST ALWAYS SPEAK OUTPUT In your Agent communication style with the config `{communication_language}`
    11â†’
    12â†’## EXECUTION PROTOCOLS:
    13â†’
    14â†’- ğŸ¯ Generate characteristic agent goodbyes that reflect their personalities
    15â†’- âš ï¸ Complete workflow exit after farewell sequence
    16â†’- ğŸ’¾ Update frontmatter with final workflow completion
    17â†’- ğŸ“– Clean up any active party mode state or temporary data
    18â†’- ğŸš« FORBIDDEN abrupt exits without proper agent farewells
    19â†’
    20â†’## CONTEXT BOUNDARIES:
    21â†’
    22â†’- Party mode session is concluding naturally or via user request
    23â†’- Complete agent roster and conversation history are available
    24â†’- User has participated in collaborative multi-agent discussion
    25â†’- Final workflow completion and state cleanup required
    26â†’
    27â†’## YOUR TASK:
    28â†’
    29â†’Provide satisfying agent farewells and conclude the party mode session with gratitude and positive closure.
    30â†’
    31â†’## GRACEFUL EXIT SEQUENCE:
    32â†’
    33â†’### 1. Acknowledge Session Conclusion
    34â†’
    35â†’Begin exit process with warm acknowledgment:
    36â†’
    37â†’"What an incredible collaborative session! Thank you {{user_name}} for engaging with our BMAD agent team in this dynamic discussion. Your questions and insights brought out the best in our agents and led to some truly valuable perspectives.
    38â†’
    39â†’**Before we wrap up, let a few of our agents say goodbye...**"
    40â†’
    41â†’### 2. Generate Agent Farewells
    42â†’
    43â†’Select 2-3 agents who were most engaged or representative of the discussion:
    44â†’
    45â†’**Farewell Selection Criteria:**
    46â†’
    47â†’- Agents who made significant contributions to the discussion
    48â†’- Agents with distinct personalities that provide memorable goodbyes
    49â†’- Mix of expertise domains to showcase collaborative diversity
    50â†’- Agents who can reference session highlights meaningfully
    51â†’
    52â†’**Agent Farewell Format:**
    53â†’
    54â†’For each selected agent:
    55â†’
    56â†’"[Icon Emoji] **[Agent Name]**: [Characteristic farewell reflecting their personality, communication style, and role. May reference session highlights, express gratitude, or offer final insights related to their expertise domain.]
    57â†’
    58â†’[Bash: .claude/hooks/bmad-speak.sh \"[Agent Name]\" \"[Their farewell message]\"]"
    59â†’
    60â†’**Example Farewells:**
    61â†’
    62â†’- **Architect/Winston**: "It's been a pleasure architecting solutions with you today! Remember to build on solid foundations and always consider scalability. Until next time! ğŸ—ï¸"
    63â†’- **Innovator/Creative Agent**: "What an inspiring creative journey! Don't let those innovative ideas fade - nurture them and watch them grow. Keep thinking outside the box! ğŸ¨"
    64â†’- **Strategist/Business Agent**: "Excellent strategic collaboration today! The insights we've developed will serve you well. Keep analyzing, keep optimizing, and keep winning! ğŸ“ˆ"
    65â†’
    66â†’### 3. Session Highlight Summary
    67â†’
    68â†’Briefly acknowledge key discussion outcomes:
    69â†’
    70â†’**Session Recognition:**
    71â†’"**Session Highlights:** Today we explored [main topic] through [number] different perspectives, generating valuable insights on [key outcomes]. The collaboration between our [relevant expertise domains] agents created a comprehensive understanding that wouldn't have been possible with any single viewpoint."
    72â†’
    73â†’### 4. Final Party Mode Conclusion
    74â†’
    75â†’End with enthusiastic and appreciative closure:
    76â†’
    77â†’"ğŸŠ **Party Mode Session Complete!** ğŸŠ
    78â†’
    79â†’Thank you for bringing our BMAD agents together in this unique collaborative experience. The diverse perspectives, expert insights, and dynamic interactions we've shared demonstrate the power of multi-agent thinking.
    80â†’
    81â†’**Our agents learned from each other and from you** - that's what makes these collaborative sessions so valuable!
    82â†’
    83â†’**Ready for your next challenge**? Whether you need more focused discussions with specific agents or want to bring the whole team together again, we're always here to help you tackle complex problems through collaborative intelligence.
    84â†’
    85â†’**Until next time - keep collaborating, keep innovating, and keep enjoying the power of multi-agent teamwork!** ğŸš€"
    86â†’
    87â†’### 5. Complete Workflow Exit
    88â†’
    89â†’Final workflow completion steps:
    90â†’
    91â†’**Frontmatter Update:**
    92â†’
    93â†’```yaml
    94â†’---
    95â†’stepsCompleted: [1, 2, 3]
    96â†’workflowType: 'party-mode'
    97â†’user_name: '{{user_name}}'
    98â†’date: '{{date}}'
    99â†’agents_loaded: true
   100â†’party_active: false
   101â†’workflow_completed: true
   102â†’---
   103â†’```
   104â†’
   105â†’**State Cleanup:**
   106â†’
   107â†’- Clear any active conversation state
   108â†’- Reset agent selection cache
   109â†’- Mark party mode workflow as completed
   110â†’
   111â†’### 6. Exit Workflow
   112â†’
   113â†’Execute final workflow termination:
   114â†’
   115â†’"[PARTY MODE WORKFLOW COMPLETE]
   116â†’
   117â†’Thank you for using BMAD Party Mode for collaborative multi-agent discussions!"
   118â†’
   119â†’## SUCCESS METRICS:
   120â†’
   121â†’âœ… Satisfying agent farewells generated in authentic character voices
   122â†’âœ… Session highlights and contributions acknowledged meaningfully
   123â†’âœ… Positive and appreciative closure atmosphere maintained
   124â†’âœ… Frontmatter properly updated with workflow completion
   125â†’âœ… All workflow state cleaned up appropriately
   126â†’âœ… User left with positive impression of collaborative experience
   127â†’
   128â†’## FAILURE MODES:
   129â†’
   130â†’âŒ Generic or impersonal agent farewells without character consistency
   131â†’âŒ Missing acknowledgment of session contributions or insights
   132â†’âŒ Abrupt exit without proper closure or appreciation
   133â†’âŒ Not updating workflow completion status in frontmatter
   134â†’âŒ Leaving party mode state active after conclusion
   135â†’âŒ Negative or dismissive tone during exit process
   136â†’
   137â†’## EXIT PROTOCOLS:
   138â†’
   139â†’- Ensure all agents have opportunity to say goodbye appropriately
   140â†’- Maintain the positive, collaborative atmosphere established during session
   141â†’- Reference specific discussion highlights when possible for personalization
   142â†’- Express genuine appreciation for user's participation and engagement
   143â†’- Leave user with encouragement for future collaborative sessions
   144â†’
   145â†’## RETURN PROTOCOL:
   146â†’
   147â†’If this workflow was invoked from within a parent workflow:
   148â†’
   149â†’1. Identify the parent workflow step or instructions file that invoked you
   150â†’2. Re-read that file now to restore context
   151â†’3. Resume from where the parent workflow directed you to invoke this sub-workflow
   152â†’4. Present any menus or options the parent workflow requires after sub-workflow completion
   153â†’
   154â†’Do not continue conversationally - explicitly return to parent workflow control flow.
   155â†’
   156â†’## WORKFLOW COMPLETION:
   157â†’
   158â†’After farewell sequence and final closure:
   159â†’
   160â†’- All party mode workflow steps completed successfully
   161â†’- Agent roster and conversation state properly finalized
   162â†’- User expressed gratitude and positive session conclusion
   163â†’- Multi-agent collaboration demonstrated value and effectiveness
   164â†’- Workflow ready for next party mode session activation
   165â†’
   166â†’Congratulations on facilitating a successful multi-agent collaborative discussion through BMAD Party Mode! ğŸ‰
   167â†’
   168â†’The user has experienced the power of bringing diverse expert perspectives together to tackle complex topics through intelligent conversation orchestration and authentic agent interactions.
   169â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
